Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Jmd B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and was very pleased. Staff was very friendly and polite throughout my stay. The room was very clean, bed was firm but comfortable. Hotel was busy but quiet in the hallways, not a lot of noise as you would expect in a hotel so close to the attractions. Convenient location. Didn't take advantage of the bar or pool area but both looked clean and inviting. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoadQueen07
Reviews.Content: Nice Hilton property close by all the attractions made famous in Orlando. My room was extra clean and it was everything I expected from the Hilton. Slept like a baby in the oh-so-comfortable king size bed. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Every employee I ran into during my stay went out of their way to greet me. Very nice. Continental breakfast had a good selection. You can also order eggs and such to order. There's a cute little Tiki bar on the property next to the outdoor pool and spa. Nice to sit outside and unwind - have a drink or two and not worry about driving back to the hotel. You're there already! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, property, and location.”
Reviews.Author: pats9090
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property only one night, but could have stayed many more. Wonderful staff at reception, and every employee we came in contact with offered a hello or asked if everything was as it should be. Traveling with small children is sometime difficult, but this hotel seemed to anticipate our every need. The pools size, great hot tub, and cabanas were a great surprise. Definitely will stay again anytime in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Simone1204
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night. The staff were courteous, professional, and very helpful. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and very clean. We have designated this hotel for future visits when we visit Universal/Wet and Wild. It only took about 5 minutes to reach the theme parks. It takes less than 5 minutes to get to Wet and Wild depending on traffic. Lots of restaurants and activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrssmall23
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for a long weekend. We arrived very early, but the front desk went out of their way to accommodate us (and continued to do so for the rest of our stay, offering advice about the area and helping us out with cabs, etc - Betzaida and Giselle are the best!). I thought our room looked more up-to-date than the pictures online, and our beds were very comfortable. The rooms were very clean, and housekeeping did a good job taking care of our room each day. The pool area was great even though the sun didn't come out for our stay - at least we got to use the hot tub! We also had a great time at the tiki bar - Colin the bartender was awesome! The tiki bar is a great place to meet other hotel guests; it felt like we were all on vacation together. We had breakfast there one day and it was well worth the price - it's buffet with made to order eggs and waffles, and even the warm food in the buffet was much better quality than we had the previous day at Sizzler. The hotel was a perfect location to Universal Studios - maybe a $10 cab ride, although you could walk it if you'd rather. Considering the parking at Universal is $15, well worth not having to worry about driving home after a night at City Walk. The hotel is right in the middle of everything in Orlando - all the restaurants on I-drive and the outlet mall just a 5 minute drive. We would definitely stay here again - we had a blast!! All of the staff members we encountered while we were there were so happy and helpful - you can tell that they actually enjoy coming to work, even when they have the overnight shift. Definitely a nice surprise to get such service for the price of a Hilton Garden Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and recommend!”
Reviews.Author: mpmramsey
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was very clean, from the lobby to the rooms. My husband and I just needed a clean, comfortable place to sleep, and we found it! They also had a large pool area with lots of chairs. The front desk receptionist was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and events.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Hilton Garden Inn stay”
Reviews.Author: shoreguynj
Reviews.Content: Over the last few weeks I have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for a number of business trips. I have always had excellent service from the hotel staff, the rooms are consistantly clean and comfortable. The hotel is located off International Drive on a "U" street that is very close to Wet and Wild water park (across the street on I drive) and Congo miniture golf (down the block). There is a wide variarty of attractions on I drive and many well known resturants are close by. Universal is also within walking distance, but would be difficult with children.Over a mile away) Breakfast is excellent with food cooled to order by the chef and freash fruit available. I have not eaten dinner at the hotel so I can not review the quilty An excellent feature is free parking. Many hotels in the area charge to park your car. This location has free parking (although not many spaces, so be prepared to have to find a space). For each of my stays I was in both double standard beds and king sized bed. All were comfortable / clean. Room service was very good. Never had any issues with room cleaning or comfort. I would recommend for business travel for having a welcoming atmoshere, friendly staff, central location and a great value. Travel for couples and small familes would likely be OK, but the room are not suite sized. Another Holtion sister hotel is located across the parking lot with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent but i question employees judgment”
Reviews.Author: stushu
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2/4 2/5 and this was the typical hilton garden inn. all the employees were extremely pleasant and willing to help and everything was very clean. breakfast was excellent, nice pool with a tiki hut bar. at just over a hundred dollars a night you just can't go wrong staying here. we did have one major problem when we arrived we called to see if we could check in early they said sure anytime. we checked in went to dinner spent time at the pool and i went to room while the wife hit the treadmill. while i was in the room i started hearing these loud vibration noises coming from the roof and they never stopped well i waited and let my wife hear them when she got back and she agreed we cant sleep here. i packed up while she got us another room. my wife said the girl at the desk said she had heard complaints about this room before at that point i ask myself why would they put someone in this room knowing about this problem when the hotel was half empty. this was my first problem ever at hilton garden inn so i am hoping it was just a fluke the room number is 619, don't go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: drporsche
Reviews.Content: great location if you are going to Universal. We took a taxi and it was cheaper than parking rate, plus it gets you right up close to the entrance instead of having a 3 mile hike to get to the parks. They have a shuttle in the day, but we went at night so we could drink responsibilly. Room was good, had a fridge, coffee maker and good size.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: hotelsontheroad
Reviews.Content: We will stay at this place again. Breadfast was excellent I had a omlet , my wife had poach eggs and this was free as part of there free breadfast. Room had mini refrig Bigand roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Place to Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: purplesummer79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days during our trip to Universal Studios. The staff was quick and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was hot, fresh and there was plenty to choose from. The pool area was spotless and very relaxing. I would stay here again and again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: In all honesty, I was a little hesitant at staying at the Hilton Garden Inn. I am used to traveling for work and staying at 4 to 5 star hotels. But when I am spending my own money, I need to go with something less pricey. My husband and I needed a hotel for an impromptu trip to Universal. We chose this hotel because of their reasonable rates, free parking, free Universal shuttle, free wi-fi, and free breakfast. All other similarly priced hotels did not offer all of the before mentioned amenities. I was really impressed by the service we received. Everyone was nice and went out of their way to be accommodating. They even allowed us to use an unused breakfast voucher for a friend from the day before. The hotel was very clean. The only comment I will make about the hotel is that it seems a little outdated - but they make the best of the structure they have. The breakfast was standard - but there was ample selection. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel as for a budget conscious family.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back”
Reviews.Author: rookieat50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days up to and including christmas, which can be a challenge. First, the price was right there, very competitive. Second, I don't know if you can do better when it comes to proximity to Universal for the price. The hotel is a stop for a shuttle to the park. Unfortunately, they were the first stop of about 5 before you got to the park. The subsequent days we walked to the park (15 minutes over a bridge spanning the interstate, reccomended). I would assume by car it would be two or three minutes. not having a car, (we flew in and cabbed to the hotel, $50+) we were limited in our traveling the area. This was no problem, as our focus was the theme park. There were many options in the park for meals, but be prepared to pay. We ate twice at the restaurant in the HGI, the breakfast buffet being the highlight. Freshly prepared omelets, eggs, bacon,hash browns fruit, waffles, pastries. Really nicely done, worth the price, and eliminated the stress of finding a good breakfast spot. Don't bother looking, or going to Dennys. Have your breakfast here. Dinner was another story, however it was christmas eve, and we ate in our room, so we got pizzas. Not reccomended, but thats just one option from the menu. I can'tspeak forthe rest of the menu. The room was clean, and quiet and included everything we needed. Beds were a bit soft,( I'm accustomed to firmer) The staff were cordial and attentive from the omelet chef to the tiki bar tender. The pool was more than sufficient to satisfy our 11 year old, clean and well kept. There were always sufficient towels and lounge chairs, some of these under cabana like structures. All in all, if you're into value, (and who isn't), HGI International Drive should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this convenient hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Diva21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with a small group of friends (3 separate rooms) and had a wonderful time. Hotel is very conveniently located to Universal Studios (under 5 minutes) as well as tons of restaurants and shops. Rooms were all spotless, well-appointed and cleaned promptly every day. Pool area was very nice and the happy hour specials at the tiki bar poolside were great. Service was very good and no one minded when we set up and iPod with speakers and played dj for the pool area. We ate breakfast at the hotel 2 out of 3 mornings and I have to say, the food was exceptional. Eggs and omelets cooked to order, a fantastic yogurt and fruit parfait, pancakes, pastries, etc. Coffee was a bit weaker than we like, but we're high-octane types. Service in the restaurant area was extremely friendly and prompt. There was some confusion at check in with one of the rooms, but the hotel staff handled it wonderfully and I was only delayed about 10 minutes getting into my room. Andrew and Jackie at the front desk went above and beyond to get the situation straightened out. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and I know none of them would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “only one issue”
Reviews.Author: urgeoverkill
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean and quiet ,close to the universal theme parks and outlet shopping .the only issue i had was the cold breakfast from the coffee to the food. i would stay here again but i wouldn't pay to eat breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located to visit Universal Theme Parks, new, clean rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: judyisreadytogo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our week-end stay here. We were in Florida to visit Universal Theme Parks, and this hotel was perfect for us. It's only about a mile to the Park, and it's very comfortable. They had a nice pool area, although we didn't have time to use it this trip. Most importantly, we received early admission to Universal, which we used to visit the new Harry Potter site at 8 AM before the crowds arrived at regular opening time an hour later. There was a shuttle bus to the park, but we drove since we didn't want to be tied to the bus schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Jeb1217
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of its location. It is 1 mile to Universal Studios and right off International Drive. The hotel was spotless in both the public areas and the room. The bathtub was literally "squeeky clean". The room was good sized with a work desk outfited with a internet port and outlets. There was a comfortable seating chair in the corner. The room also has a minifridge and coffee maker. The kingsized bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows and blankets. Bathroom had lots ot large heavy towels. It has a nice pool area with an adjoining Tiki Bar. There is a restaurant although breakfast was a bit overpriced but pretty typical for upper end hotels. The front desk also has a selection of drinks and snacks available for sale. The one nice thing was parking was free. Although this is typical in Orlando, once or twice I have be caught by hotels charging $12-$20/night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: elsewhere1313
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to Universal Studios and reasonably priced. Since we were only staying for the night and knew we wouldn't be in the room for long, we weren't really concerned with the amenities at the hotel. However we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable. We plan on going back next time we visit Universal/Citywalk. We were able to get a cab for 4 people to Universal for $8 total. You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ESAC
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I've stayed in several hotels in the area including the Springfield Suites and the Fairfield and the Hilton Garden Inn is my top choice in the area for the price and location. As far as location goes, this hotel is much easier to get to than most hotels in the convention center area as you can avoid the traffic on Sand Lake Dr by using the Kirkman exit on the Freeway. Sand Lake Dr should be avoided at all costs during rush hour traffic. That said, if you are in Orlando merely to go to Disney, I would go to the Buena Vista area, but if you want a place close near Universal or downtown this is a great choice. Downtown Orlando is certainly underestimated as an Orlando destination and I would highly recommend a visit to Lake Eola during your visit. As far as price goes, HGI usually runs around $100/night as compared to other hotels for $125+. The carpeting and paint is clearly a bit old (can anyone say seafoam green?), but all the other furnishings have been updated recently and in all my stays my room has been very clean and I have never seen any bugs. For restaurants in the area try Season's 52, Blue Martini, and Dexter's (downtown).

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: bears0411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a last minute trip on Wednesday 8/31/2011 to Orlando from NYC. We booked our flight for 9/1/2011, we were to land in Orlando at 1245 am and then after picking up an already reserved rental car we were going to spend the night with friends of ours. Well our friends didnt answer their phone but Cat at the Hilton Garden Inn did. We were scheduled to spend Friday and Saturday nights there, when I called on Thursday at 1:25 AM Cat was very helpful, got us a fabulous rate and we had a place to stay. The moment we walked in CAT said "Mr & Mrs &*^%, Welcome home !" She made the check in very quick,provided us with a well appointed and immaculate king room on the sixth floor. The Hotel was wall maintained, breakfast was delicious, the pool, spa, Tiki Bar and cabanas were very clean and open til 11:00 pm which was a plus. The hotel is a 3 minute drive to Universal Studios, accross the street from Wet and Wild and about 5 minutes to I4. The location is convienent to all Tourist areas. It was great not being in the heart of I drive. This was our 3rd stay at a Hilton Garden Inn and I assure you it will not be our last !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthBelfast
Reviews.Content: We were given excellent interconnecting rooms for our family of four. Our two teenage boys had their own double beds and bathroom in a spacious room and we had a kingsize bed in the interconnecting room. The rooms were of a high standard and daily service kept them really clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool was excellent. We were extremely pleased with the facilities and service and would highly recommend this hotel to families wanting high standards of comfort and service while they explore the theme parks and restaurants. This hotel is suitable as a base and not for relaxation in the evening as there is limited bar and no entertainment facilities within the hotel. The lobby area is merely a waiting-type space and not a place to chill and relax in the evening. We did not eat at the hotel in the evenings as this was not recommended to us through comments we read on tripadvisor. Indeed, we found the restaurant and outside bar area empty on a nightly basis. Breakfasts were limited. I dont know whether limitations in bar, dining and entertainment reflects the purpose of the hotel which is to provide high standards of comfort and service (very friendly and helpful staff) at a reasonable price. I presume that raising the standards in bar, dining and entertainment would also raise the cost of staying in this hotel. We did not require entertainment and dining as we spent the day and evening at the theme parks and in recommended restaurants. This might not suit others who require entertainment, dining etc in the evening after a long day visiting the theme parks or who want to skip these every so often to spend time chilling at the hotel. I think with a little more imagination (and without raising the cost too much), the dining area could be transformed into a bistro-type bar/restaurant with comfortable sofa-type seating offering a good standard and range of food and bar service including cocktails. This would encourage people to relax and dine in the hotel which would create a livelier atmosphere. I wonder too whether offering a basic massage service would add to the overall service of this hotel. This need not cost much (ie a basic massage room) and I'm sure would be a hit among those attending the theme parks and walking for miles in any given day! While all the staff were excellent, Jackie at reception and Sandra at breakfast deserve special mention. Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if going to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: StuGautz
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel primarily for the proximity to Universal Studios. The staff went out of their way to be extra helpful. Very clean hotel and really comfortable beds. Really couldn't ask for much more in a hotel. If I visit Orlando again, I would definitely stay here. For a room that cost $88.88 after tax, I don't think there is a better value around.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and good value”
Reviews.Author: gomummy
Reviews.Content: Booked online through Hilton Honors program, to receive reward points and save an additional 20% which included a hot made to order breakfast for 8 days (less than $100/nt). The hotel is across the street from Wet n' Wild water park and less than 10 min drive to Universal Studios. In addition, the hotel is about a 20 min drive from Disney. There are plenty of restaurants of all price ranges, and different attractions to do along International Drive. The accommodations were comfortable, clean and the room we had was on the 6th floor (nonsmoking) was fairly quiet even though its a busy hotel (mixture of business and vacation guests). Room had a micro, minifridge and coffee maker. The breakfast buffet was hot with a variety of choices, made to order eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, cereals, waffles, fresh fruit, hot and cold beverages. Just make sure the when you book, it states comp breakfast, otherwise its an additional cost from your hotel price. Only negative was housekeeping who did not replenish our room with fresh mugs/glassware after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel convenient to Universal Orlando and wit a great pool”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights bracketing a day at Universal Orlando. We arrived early in the afternoon, were able to check in, and spent the rest of the day in the pool. The pool is a nice size, and is surrounded by a bunch of cabanas for shade. There is also a small tiki bar open in the evenings. The bartender is a super-nice guy - I'm sorry I didn't get his name. Having had a few cocktails at the pool, we weren't about to drive to a restaurant for dinner, so we ate right in the hotel. The food was decent, but nothing to rave about. I have a hunch they don't see very much dinner business. Our server was pretty tentative, like it wasn't her real job. The cook actually came out to thank us. They have an excellent breakfast buffet with cooked to order omelets and eggs at a very reasonable price. The morning servers are very nice and attentive. Our room was comfortable and quiet - we could even see some of the coasters over at the parks. The hotel is a very short drive over to the Universal Parks, and offer a shuttle (though we didn't use it). We would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jabba-DS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 10days, it is perfectly located if you're doing all the usual Orlando family attractions. Its just a five minute walk to Wet and Wild waterpark, the Universal parks are very close, you could walk, but there's also a free shuttle bus from outside the hotel. Its only a ten minute drive to Seaworld and Aquatica also. You're round the corner from Dennys and Ihop, which are good for breakfast or just general food. The room was lovely, nice and clean, comfy bed. HD tv in the room with loads of channels, most of which are actually HD!! The hotel pool was also nice, with a hot tub and plenty of loungers and a little bar beside the pool. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful as were the cleaners and other staff. Our only downside to the hotel was the food, we stayed in the hotel for breakfast the first morning,and it really wasn't nice and ended up being fairly expensive, so after that we ate in Dennys or Ihop in the mornings, which ended up being cheaper and better food. We also tried the restaurant in the hotel on another evening, the food was fairly crap and so was the service, but I really wouldn't write the hotel off for this. It's a lovely hotel that has a fairly good pricetag for a hotel thats close to everything with a good pool and theres so many other places to eat in the area anyway. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to be close to everything but its also quiet because its on a side street. Possibly book it directly to get better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, but the breakfast is not include and is very expensive”
Reviews.Author: JohnOttawa72
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel trough hotel.com and was good, the only issue was the breakfast. If you see the advertise is very tricky and is not clear to say that the breakfast is NOT INCLUDE in the rate. I was counting with this and my big surprise was a $11 the buffet, and BTW was very poor. You can fine $6 dollar breakfast very close. I recommended it for your days in Universal / Sea World parks. 20min to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Economical alternative to staying in the park”
Reviews.Author: kewpie1
Reviews.Content: Two years ago while visiting Universal Studios, my son & I stayed at the Royal Pacific Hotel. We enjoyed the fast pass advantages, but not the surcharges for internet, parking & meals where less expensive hotels include as complimentary; the higher price hotels seem to charge for everything. So this time, we opted to stay at the conveniently located Hilton Garden Inn just over the bridge from Universal. It is possible to walk, but after spending a day in the park, one just wants to leave a bit more expediently. We purchased a breakfast package. The room was fine - had some paint touch ups on the wall, but other than that the room met our needs. The breakfast food is decent w/omelet to order cook available & other typical continental food offerings. We really just wanted a convenient location for access to Universal & this fit the bill - literally & figuratively!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DayTripperDave21
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose this hotel from Expedia with limited info (apart from other Trip Advisor comments). We weren't disappointed. There were 4 of us staying and we booked two rooms, both with two double beds and a connecting door. Happy all round! The location is great for Universal Theme Park and Wet n Wild as they are 5 mins away, but the hotel also puts on a free shuttle to the other parks on the North side of I-Drive which is great. The reception staff were very friendly, happy to help us find our way to various places as well as recommend places to visit and restaurants/bars. And there were freshly baked cookies on reception each evening - this went down very well! The pool area was very nice, comfy loungers and complemetary 'pool towels' - a lovely touch. The hotel has a poolside Tiki Bar which did lack a bit of atmosphere but sat outside in the warm (November!!) evenings with a cocktail can't be moaned at. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and it was great value for the level of comfort and service we received - great work guys.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnaelliiott
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean, the staff is very accommodating (I asked for extra towels at Midnight, Ms. Cat ( the night desk person) was very, very nice by delivering them to our room as well as directions to the Kennedy Space Center, I had asked for. My experience with this hotel was nothing but DELIGHTFUL. My Son's feel the same. Thank you Hilton Garden Inn on American Way!!!

Reviews.Title: “bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: stanley23913548
Reviews.Content: The good. firm beds, excellent breakfast, friendly staff, nice poolside accoutrements & a small but effective business center. The bad. Nothing bad. Attention to detail, the backbone of many a business, included egonomically friendly placing of the bathroom tissue, whereas, in many an establishment, leaning or stretching forward to grasp the roll, turned the bowl into a bidet. The crystal glasses in the room, were on the tiny side, and reminded me of Rev. Maddock and the Temperance Society at Exploits, where he would have held such a glass, and said, " a small sip from a small glass, is a large step towards sobriety. Today however, the sublime message brought about by these same glasses, would probably be "don't drink & WI-FI, it can't be undone, but you can". Only teasing Hilton, it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value. Nice big swimming pool area. Great location”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: My title says it all! I always find that Hilton Garden Inns are good value and very comfortable and this was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in I-Drive, very good staff”
Reviews.Author: brazilflyer333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn for two nights on points, and it was a great way to wrap up our vacation. The property seems pretty new, in that everything looked impeccably clean to me. From carpet throughout the hotel, to nice new lobby furniture, the dining area, fitness room and the hotel rooms, this was the cleanest we've stayed at in a while. Front desk staff were professional and helpful, even loaning us an umbrella on a rainy morning so we could walk to a restaurant. They also push the teens out of the business center when an adult needs the place for work. For their listed price, $100+, I'd encourage the hotel to reconsider including free breakfast. With all the competition on I-Drive, I'd argue that this price is a bit high not to include breakfast, when I know many competitors on the strip do. And finally, best hotel bed of my life. I can't remember the name of Hilton's special bed, but it is without a doubt the most comfortable hotel bed ever. Has adjustable "pressure zones" as well.

Reviews.Title: “Expect more from HGI - need to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TLD2006
Reviews.Content: They just need to upgrade the electronics and furniture, and it would be fine. Location is OK if thats the side of town you want, plenty of restaurants in the area. I would stay at a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal Studios, Wet&Wild”
Reviews.Author: HerrOlsson
Reviews.Content: Well you need a car in Orlano anyway, this hotel is tucked in a crescent right next to Homewood suited right off International drive. Premier Outlets is a short drive away. The only think to realisticly walk to is Red Lobster across from the hotel. The hotel has a shuttle to Universal, but we didnÂ´t use it since itÂ´s on a hotel route stopping at different hotel and the drive is less than five minutes by own car. Rooms were standard HGI and the breakfast service was fast and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay......”
Reviews.Author: marandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and found it to be a very good location and very convenient waking distance to collect a hire car from the local Alamo rental office. Excellent staff, comfortable room, good restaurant and Tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and amenities for the price”
Reviews.Author: 2newkitties
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for a conference. The staff was outstanding. Everyuone was patient, curteous, and always greated me with a smile and friendly word. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Free internet-free printing-warm cookies at night-hot tea/coffee in the morning-free fitness room. MUCH better than the fancy convention center hotels where my colleagues were nickeled and dimed. Special thanks to Michele who helped me print my boarding pass after we both experienced computer issues.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Miami_FLJen
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel in the past 2 1/2 years. Convenient location, friendly staff, and great value. Had an issue at check out-I was being charged more than what I was told the room would cost when I reserved over the phone, but Jacki quickly fixed the problem. Opportunities for improvement - The rooms themselves could benefit from a fresh coat of paint. There are spots on the wall where it is obvious that they have touched up the paint, but it doesn't match. Water pressure in shower on 6th floor not the best, but good enough. I made sure that I conducted a thorough bedbug check upon arrival and was quite satisfied when I didn't see any evidence (I checked mattress, pillows and even took apart the rollaway bed). This hotel is close to Universal and close to the restaurants on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Not so popular with me”
Reviews.Author: specialk6229
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of those reviews that will more than likely not be posted on the hotel's website. Here's why. My sister reserved several rooms (10 to be exact) for a one night stay at the hotel. We were scheduled to arrive on saturday, Nov 20. My husband and I agreed to attend along with several other friends and family members. However, approximately 2 to 3 days before our scheduled arrival, my husband came down with a severe cough. We didn't think it was anything serious. On Nov 18, we contacted our doctor. He requested that my husband come in for an emergency visit on saturday, Nov 20. Finally, we were told that my husband had a severe case of bronchitis and that he should immediately began taking antibiotics, drink lots of fluids, but most importantly, rest. After notifying the hotel of his condition, I was informed that the only way to cancel our hotel stay and receive a full refund was if my husband was admitted to a hospital, accompanied by a hospital note. I find it demeaning, as well as unjustifiable that a person has to be admitted to a hospital before your hotel recognizes them as having a serious health condition. I travel a great deal with my job, as well as personal travel and have never encountered such deliberate disregard for others. It is obvious that your company's only interest and goal is "to get as much money from customers at any cost." Therefore, I have decided that I will not patronize your company due to this policy. It is unfortunate that my husband came down with this condition prior to our scheduled visit at your hotel, however it was unexpected and unforseen on our part. I feel as though we have been punished as a result of that. Please take the time to review your policy on this issue. Beverly Holmes

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a staff to match.”
Reviews.Author: SlotqueenNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel on October 16. We were staying for 4 nights. I was very pleasantly surprised what a really nice 3 star hotel the Hilton Garden Inn was. The desk staff was very friendly and made you feel welcome. The room itself was a decent size and I would say recently refurnished. The bathroom could of been larger, but was very well stocked with towels of all sizes. The location was perfect. We were right near Wet n Wild and Universal. The Disney parks were only about 10 minutes away. Plenty of restaurants and a 24 hr Walgreens nearby. When I asked the front desk for a late check-out (flight home not till 7:25pm), they gave us the room till 3. I stayed at the pool till about 2 on that day which was spotless and empty. Really beautiful. The night before we left I went downstairs to print our boarding passes. There is free internet service, free parking and no ridculous charges per day for anything. If you asked the desk for directions to a place they would google it for you and print it right out. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Citynews
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel and would just like to say what a great stay we had . The hotel is in an excellent location, just off International Drive, but well within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The staff we dealt with were, without exception, cheerful, smilling and always helpful. We had a room which was a very nice size, complete with tea/coffee making facilities, and a microwave and fridge, which was a real bonus for keeping food and drinks cool in the room. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept on whilst on holiday and the room was cleaned everyday with fresh white fluffy towels, not like the off-white hard things you get in some hotels!!. The other major bonus as far as we were concerned was the free wi-fi access in the rooms - I was having trouble with my mobile phone whilst in Orlando, so keeping in touch with home by email was invaluable. We also used the guest laundry whilst we were there - also a very useful amenity. The pool area was spotlessly clean, as were all the public areas of the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food there. Overall, I would recommend this hotel 100% for anyone thinking of visiting Orlando - we will definitely stay here again when we next return, hopefully with the rest of our family ! Thank you to all staff who work at the hotel for making our stay so enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Ead824
Reviews.Content: The Service and Staff were Fabulous! (Jackie, Jose, Soyara, China, Orlando, & Irma) The bartenders at the Tiki Bar were great as well (Sorry cannot remember their names)The hotel, rooms, pool area, gym were all immaculately clean and everything worked fine no problems. We had the complimentary breakfast which had hot food made to order, fresh fruit, cold cereal, hot cereal (oatmeal & Grits), pastries, waffles-you make yourself but it doesn't take long at all, breakfast meats (bacon, sausage links & patties, sausage gravy & biscuits(my favorite), & potatoes. Everyday we had something different we saved $30.00 a day equivalent to $210.00 for the week with this breakfast. If you eat dinner in the hotel the food is reasonably priced and very good, if you decide to eat off the property their are restaurants all over I-Drive. (Bahama Breeze was the best during our trip) Location was AWESOME best for Universal Studios, Islands Of Adventure, City Walk, Seaworld, Aquatica & Wet & Wild and if you like shopping the Outlets are right up I-Drive North. Through our week long trip we only used 1/2 tank of gas (more savings) and we hit all the attractions above. I recommend this Hotel to everyone you will really enjoy your stay and meet some great people. Oh lastly the photos online at the various sites for this hotel do not do it justice it is so much nicer when you are actually there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: uxb46
Reviews.Content: On arrival the exterior is Welcoming.Gardens, Flower Borders and Clean,Entrance through automatic doors into Large Lobby area with seating and plants very clean.Booking in a real breeze Receptionist Very Welcoming & Professional had all details to hand within seconds (2 Couples booking in)gave us a quick run down on hotel and facilites offered.Rooms are spacious and airy cleaned every day to a high standard.Beds really Comfy,Bathrooms had Soap,Shampoo & Shower Gel suppllied daily plus clean towels as and when required.Also a Refrigerator in room and Large Screen TV and tea/coffee making facility this also repenished daily.Excellent swimming pool also shallow 1 for Younger Travellers always Clean. Reception are excellent for information ie taxis,buses,shows ect although they sell tickets unlike some hotels this 1 does not push You to buy there. All in all a great place to stay with excellent staff that make You Feel At Home...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Drewhuge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights in August with some family members recently and was very impressed with the Hilton Garden Inn. We'd chosen it based on the positive reviews and the location - it's a decent walk from Universal Studios, or a mere $8 taxi ride away. The kids we were with were too old for Disney, so we were happy with this. Having stayed in other Orlando hotels and motels, this was easily the cleanest - none of that Florida musty odour! Housekeeping was great. Our room was spacious, with two comfortable beds, desk, a couple of seats, useful fridge and microwave, nice fluffy towels, pretty quiet, great air-con (it was 95 outside, so thank god for that). We paid to eat breakfast a couple of times and really enjoyed it. Yes, you can get cheaper a short walk away (Denny's and IHOP are the nearest, there's a Sizzler a stones throw away), but there was as much as you can eat, a waffle maker, and the chef made custom omelettes as well. If you get a rate that includes breakfast, you'll be very happy. Internet use in the business centre is free, and there was usually a computer free. But what really made our stay was the pool and tiki bar. We were there in peak time, but the pool was never too busy, we could always get a cabana, and there are free towels provided for pool users. There's a warm spa pool as well. The staff at the tiki bar were great, with a happy hour from 4-6pm, and you could order food from the restaurant and have it brought out to you. The front-desk staff were - with one slight exception, a woman who advised my sister to sign the wrong part of the form you fill in for access to your safety deposit box and was insistent even when my sister pointed out her mistake - charming and helpful, and the car service they used when we needed taxis were really nice too. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. If you're going to spend any time at Universal, it's perfect. If you want to chill poolside, it's perfect. And there are plenty of eating and drinking and shopping places - you're only a 5 minute i-ride trolley away from Prime Outlets - in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great price - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1966_MI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-July with my teenage son for our annual father/son vacation. Our main destination was US/IOA and the new Harry Potter attraction. The hotel is newer, with clean rooms, pleasant decor, friendly staff, and an overall good value. I booked the room on-line and decided to purchase the (pre-paid) package which included breakfast everyday. The price was $90/night with the breakfast included. The room was large and spacious, and not to mention CLEAN. The pool was large and never crowded, and the little "tiki-hut" served bar food and drinks, which was a nice thing after a long day at the theme parks. The only "issue" that I had initially was with the free shuttle to the Parks. Upon checking in, I was told to walk across the parking lot to the Homewood Suites the following morning around 7:30 AM to "reserve a spot" on the shuttle. I did that the following morning only to find out the bus was already full, and fills up THE DAY BEFORE. Upon returning back to the HGI, they did call another free shuttle service, which took us to the park, but at a little later time. So, my advice is, reserve the shuttle the day before for the following day departure. They only have 2 departure and pick-up times in the AM and PM, so make sure you are aware of that. The (second shuttle) service will actually pick you up any time you want to come back from the park, so I used them mostly. Otherwise, things were fine. There were a few restaurants within walking distance to the hotel (IHOP and Denny's, Red Lobster) so either take the trolley bus thingy, or drive yourself if you have a car to find other options. For the value, and accomodations, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy,frig didn't work, free shuttle a joke,breakfast was good”
Reviews.Author: ixrayu72
Reviews.Content: Our frig didn't work, and I had meds that had to keep cold, the free shuttle to parks had to have reservations made the day before , or you couldn't use it,didnt run very often, we could here the people next door talking, and their tv through the wall. I must say the breakfast was good. Pool was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright, and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: snowdrop18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my 21 year old daughter. When we arrived, we had an easy check-in. Upon arriving in our room, we found it to be spotless and clean-smelling. The room had two double beds, a large desk and ergonomic chair, an armchair with ottoman and dresser with a tv on top. It also had a microwave and small fridge. At first, we found that the fridge was not working. We called the front desk right away because my daughter needed to refrigerate her insulin. They sent someone up immediately and the problem was fixed. During our stay, our room was always nice and cool. Florida was going through a real heat spell, so it was nice to have a place to cool down. I found the beds to be on the soft side, but the sheets and pillows were always clean and fluffy. I liked that they give you the option of not having the sheets changed daily...we take great lengths to care for the environment, so this was a nice thing to have available. The room was always clean by the time we returned from our day trips. There is a pool outside with a Tiki bar that is open in the late afternoon. We took the option of having the breakfast included in our stay, and I am so glad we did!! This was a great value. Hot dishes were made to order, and cereals, muffins, fresh fruit and waffles were self-serve. I don't recall ever having a better breakfast anywhere. If you can, include this option in your booking! This hotel is close to everything. Universal Studios was quite literally around the corner, and Disney was only 15 minutes away. I'm not sure of shuttle services to these parks though, as we had rented a car for our stay. Parking at the hotel is free to guests! A water park is within walking distance. Restaurants are abundant in the area, many within walking distance.This hotel is also close to major malls, grocery stores and outlet malls.

Reviews.Title: “I drive area hotel breakfast for charge...”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: I drive area hotel breakfast for charge at standard hgi lobby bar restaurant. Good clean rooms close to universal and wet n wild. Good business stop with wireless. Pool nice and has bar service out by pool. Good place. Rooms clean and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay57
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Extremely clean and the rooms are quite large. Towels are great, beds are comfortable, and the pool is well kept as well. The food at the Great American Grill is excellent, but beware because breakfast is not included. There is a package you can buy online where the rate is cheaper and breakfast is included if you pay with an advance purchase. This hotel is also within walking distance of Universal Studios/City Walk (about a mile, but pretty painless-- there are sidewalks the whole way) so that saves on parking there and gives some great choices for dinner. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. There are really no complaints to be made about this place.

Reviews.Title: “life savers!”
Reviews.Author: sgdh
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Orlando for an additional 11 days at the end of a 8 day holiday due to the volcanic ash. The hotel staff were brilliant! The general manager gave us a very favourable rate and the staff on reception (especially Jackie and Cat) could not do enough to help us. The staff all went out of their way to advise us on additional trips and helping with many minor problems. By the end, we knew all of the staff as friends. The effort they put in was well above what was required. I cannot praise this hotel enough. Oh yes, it was a lovely room and immaculately clean, food was excellent! The great bar staff at the Tiki bar taught me about American Football!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: marysi
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant stay and the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but...”
Reviews.Author: artigraphs
Reviews.Content: This is a great location on I-drive right near I-4. When we checked in we found the room to be very clean. In fact the whole hotel seemed spotless! Unfotunately we were out most of the time for meetings and were unable to enjoy the beautiful pool and hot tub. The issues we had were as follows: shower head did not change settings (broken) Room 428, They forgot to bring us new coffee daily even after we requested it again. They didn't get around to cleaning our room until about 3:30 on a daily basis. The 4th floor hallway was set at like 60 degrees (freezing!). Couldn't imagine coming back from the hot tub and hitting that ice cold hallway. It was bad enough in shorts! You'll also get flyers coming in under door from the local pizza joints at all hours of the night. They claim to have these new adjustable mattresses but I couldn't tell the difference after changing the setting to firm. I give this hotel 3 stars because of these issues which can all be corrected. You would think hilton would be better than this. I would stay here agin to give them another try because it is so clean and the staff just needs to get their act together. You can hear them arguing in the back room if you use the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redtyke987
Reviews.Content: The hotel is first class, the reception staff were very helpful and informative. Our room was lovely - really spacious and very clean. The food in the hotel restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. There is a pool which is excellent, towels provided for the pool and there are comfy sun loungers and shade if you need it. The hotel shampoo etc is Neutrogena and its really good. One slight hitch, when I booked on the internet I was expecting to be at the Hilton Garden Inn opposite Sea World, which was the only reason for staying at the Hilton, however, I think the cheaper room that I chose obviously was at this Hilton, so beware. This hotel is a good 20 minutes ride away from Sea World on the bus. There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to Sea World, it left at 9.00 but returned at 5.15 which was too early, so we had to make our own way back. Overall though excellent hotel, really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a Orlando vacation!”
Reviews.Author: realhanes
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with how nice this hotel was. When you walk in, you're greeted by a tastefully decorated lobby with fountain. The front desk is extremely friendly and they have a 24hr. pantry located next to the desk stocked with all kinds of food items, beer and wine. The restaurant was basic, but the staff was friendly and the specials looked good. Our room was decorated in a tropical design and was quite spacious. I never felt cramped even with my wife and son sharing the room. A laundry room was on the floor and the housekeeping was top notch, they always had our room cleaned and well stocked with extra towels by the time we came back from the theme parks. Their pool was a major bonus. There are cabana-type structures around the pool which provide cover from the sun and feature two lounge chairs and a table. The pool is fairly basic, but well kept and features a large hot tub. Next to the pool is a tropical tiki-bar that serves food and drinks, the whole pool area was a great place to relax after hanging out at Orlando parks all day. This is a great location. You can walk to Wet N Wild water park and Universal Studios is literally around the corner with the hotel offering a limited shuttle service to the park. You can walk to IHOP and Denny's and all the restaurants and stores of International Drive are an easy drive. This was a great find and I'll be back, if you're looking for attractive, comfortable rooms at a good value...this hotel competes with the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, solid pick!”
Reviews.Author: fliptraveler3004
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel since we were meeting other family members in Orlando and one of the families were staying here. Before reserving the hotel, I checked the reviews on tripadvisor and other sites, most if not all, came back positive. I am happy to say that I agree. This hotel had excellent service, hotel room was CLEAN and comfortable plus it was conveniently located 10 minutes away from the parks and down the street from Universal Studios. I would highly recommend this hotel! Plus, the rate ($55) that I found on hotwire was fantastic...they rate it a 3star in the Universal-I north area. It's a dice roll though, as i tried to book for another night and ended up with the sheraton four points across the street, which as good, but not as good as the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel. Do NOT get them to call you a taxi.”
Reviews.Author: clarkep10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn from second of July to the 8th. We arrived at 1 am and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist. Our room was located on the 3rd floor and had a view of the car park the room was quite and had a good air conditioning unit. Our room had an old tv but some other rooms appear to have flat screen tv's. The rooms were painted in a tropical colour ie. pale green. The cleaning staff were friendly and did a good job on our room. on the ground floor there were two computers with free internet access and free printing, all local calls in the hotel were free, The pool area was generally quite during the day and picked up at night when people got back from the parks. The pool and Jacuzzi badly needed to be cleaned. We decided to travel to the Mall at Millenia and since we weren't driving asked the front desk to call us a taxi a non marked car arrived to take us and charged us above the odds for the trip we returned to the hotel later that day by a proper taxi and paid far less for the trip. When leaving the hotel we each had two bags so did not want to walk to the road to get a taxi so we asked again for a taxi that would accept credit cards again a unmarked car arrived half way to the airport he pulled into a connivence shop and told us to go in to get money this was extremely annoying as we were using international credit cards and were going to be charged both for using the machine and an extra 10% from our bank for cash withdrawls this extremely annoyed us as we had specifically asked for a taxi that accepted credit cards and even asked again before getting into the car. Once again we were charged alot more for the trip as a normal taxi. On our last night we ordered room service which included a 20% service charge it was bland and ordering in from one of the flyer that come under the door would be cheaper and better. All in all the hotel was satisfactory but just call for your own taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Venne_Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn from June 1 - June 3. We paid $38 per night, using Hotwire - they call this a 3 star hotel in the Universal Orlando - I-drive North area. We had a quiet 3rd floor room near the elevator, overlooking the parking lot, which I liked since I could always see my car below. There are no additional charges for parking, WiFi, use of the business center or fitness center. There is no free continental breakfast, but the breakfast buffet was $12.95 and looked extensive. Coffee was free in the morning. I think this rate was incredibly inexpensive due to our stay being Monday - Wednesday, and school still in session. I was very surprised at how close this hotel was to Universal Studios, and yet still close to restaurants & shops. There were no hidden "additional fees" except Orlando's hotel taxes, but many nice amenities. There were 2 shuttles to Universal at 8:30 and 10:00 and 2 returning at 4:15 and 7:20. Universal opened at 9 and closed at 7, so we thought this was perfect since we planned to stay all day. Shuttles to/from Universal Studios arrived about 10 minutes earlier than the posted 8:30 time, and waited the full time for all to arrive at the pick-up points, but left promptly. So don't be late! It was wonderful not to have to pay for parking at the park, and the hotel does not charge a parking fee either. We brought my daughter's manual wheelchair with us, and the shuttle driver simply put it in the luggage compartment beneath the bus ( a big Greyhound-like bus). We arrived at the Universal entry gates well before the opening at 9 am even though the shuttle did stop at the hotels across from Universal first. Check in/out was very smooth. Clean and welcoming atmosphere everywhere. Shower/bath was clean, had good water pressure and drained appropriately. Cold A/C. Double beds were comfortable with fluffy comforters. Ask at the desk how to use the sleep number beds. Having the microwave, coffee maker and larger mini-fridge in room were a nice plus. We ate in the room or at nearby restaurants on International Drive because that's what the kids wanted. The hotel restaurant was small, but dishes looked elegant - served inside or by the pool. Walgreens & several restaurants (I-Hop, Denny's, Red Lobster, Sweet Tomatoes, Ponderosa) all within walking distance. The outdoor tiki bar and large hot tub were a welcome sight after a long drive and long days at the park. Pool was heated and towels were free and always available. My children especially enjoyed the "babysit a goldfish" option, available from the front desk. It made missing our pet at home a lot milder. Front desk always took the time to speak with my children and inquired regularly as to whether we were enjoying our stay. They also offered a free cookie. Didn't use the fitness center, but noticed that several guests did. It, too, looked clean and fully operational with newer equipment. WiFi worked great in room and lobby. This hotel met and exceeded our expectations because of the kind, helpful staff and overall cleanliness. On the first day, I went out the back door to the car, after giving my room card key to my daughter at the elevator. A maintenance worker saw me do this, and gently asked, "Did you know that you need your key to re-open this outside door again?" Then, he offered to wait at the exterior door until I retrieved the items from my car so that I would not be locked out. I could not find a single negative comment about this hotel and have none to offer myself. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: adrenalinejunkie207
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. We have no complaints. The staff was friendly and courteous and the room was clean and comfortable - a BIG plus in my book. They had a breakfast buffet every morning, which was a little expensive at $12.95 per person, but it was fresh and very tasty and convenient. Overall, we are very happy with our experience at this hotel. Two small things tho - it says its adjacent to Universal so we figured we could walk to Universal rather than spend $$ on a cab. Not so. They say you can walk to it, but they don't recommend it as it is a fair bit away, even though we could see the Hulk and Dr. Doom's fearfall from our window. The other thing, and this is absolutely no fault of the hotel, is DO NOT order from any menu slipped under your door. ESPECIALLY Pastino's Express. We got back too late to eat at the hotel rest. and ordered a simple sandwich and fries. TWO HOURS later, it showed up, cold and wrong. Called 3x and was told "on its way" and other excuses. AVOID THEM! Told hotel staff, who was extremely apologetic, but says they have tried to stop this menu leaving, and even called police, but unfortunately cannot do anything bc they show up looking like hotel guests and then leave the menus. Just a word of warning for any travelers thinking of this. Otherwise, had a GREAT time and very happy with stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Boatbunny
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 9 night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, had a great experience. The hotel is in a great location, upper end of International Drive, far enough away from the discount store strip malls, just off of International Drive on American Way, so you don't have the noise and lights of I Drive. It is less than 5 minutes from Universal Studios, and you can actually see the Royal Pacific Hotel from here. The pool and hot tub were very nice, there are little cabanas available to shield from the sun. Pool area and Tiki Bar were open til 11 pm. The room was spacious, refrigerator and microwave in the room. Bathroom was a good size and had Nutregena products. Beds could be a little more comfortable, I would love to see them upgrade to the comfy beds most chains have gone to. But, they were not too hard or too soft. Front desk was very helpful when needed, you can purchase tickets to all the attractions right at the hotel. There is an IHOP and a Walgreens right around the corner as well. We did not try the breakfast buffet at the hotel, it did look a little sparse compared to some of the buffets offered at other restaurants. The one thing that really impressed me was that they were in the process of repaving the parking lot and took measures to make sure that guests were not affected. They waited until mid week when the hotel was quieter, they only did one small section at a time so there wasn't any issues with parking availability, and the work started after 9 am and was done by 5 pm, so there was no noise waking people up. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “4 out of 5, very good stay”
Reviews.Author: SimAndBek
Reviews.Content: pros - close to international drive attractions, universal, wet n wild and sea world - staff very friendly and helpful -wifi worked 100% -big rooms, individual air con, - widescreen tv, no widescreen or digital channels available though. -rooms serviced daily with nice supplies, nutrogena, plenty of towels -pool area very nice, tiki bar open till 11pm nightly -free shuttle to nearby universal attractions cons - no shuttle to Disney - disneyworld is really far away, half hour drive, or over an hour for public transport - non smoking room was on the same floor as smoking rooms, so the hallway stinks......

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casalv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, American Way from 4/13-4/17/2009. The hotel was spotless, room was very big, we were given a handicapped room, not sure why. Pool area and Tiki Bar were great. Had a great vacation. Didn't take the shuttle, wasn't too clear on the times that it ran, but we took taxis to City Walk everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: GravyRobber
Reviews.Content: If you can find a good deal on this Hilton hotel, DO NOT pass it up! The location is ideal if you are planning your trip around Universal Studios, and there is a complimentary shuttle that takes you back and forth to the park. The rooms are well-appointed, with flat-screen televisions and an easy-going, Florida-esque decor. The beds are adjustable (like a Sleep Number bed), albiet not that comfortable, but a nice perk if you are picky about the softness/firmness of your mattress. Nearby restaurants include Denny's, IHOP, Red Lobster, and Sweet Tomatoes. There is also a miniature golf course within walking distance. Also convenient to the Fun Spot and Wet and Wild. They definitely take the Hilton hospitality thing seriously at his hotel, so you will be treated well. Be sure to visit Katie at the Tiki bar!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Sharon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , friendly and helpful staff , clean rooms with very comfortable beds , pool area was well kept , good location for Universal Parks and shopping outlets , not too noisey away from the main traffic in the area . For the price of the room it would have been nice to have had a free breakfast which many other hotels nearby seem to offer , so we didnt use the hotel for eating with so many dinning options just around the corner there was no need . We would consider using this hotel again , we dont have any complaints , add a complimentary breakfast to the room price and we will return next time in Orlando .

Reviews.Title: “Happy and content- will be back”
Reviews.Author: klomb4
Reviews.Content: I booked this room at the last minute when I arrived in Orlando later than originallly scheduled. I spoke with a very nice employee(Bestaida- sorry about spelling ) who was very professional and possessed excellent personal communication skills. They had no non-smoking rooms left and we were stuck with smoking rooms. I was able to check it out

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Gill68
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here as the location suited us (we've previously stayed at Homewood next door). Check in was smooth and efficient and we were assigned a room on the 5th floor. There was quite a lot of traffic noise from I4 but we chose to live with it rather than ask to be moved. The room was fairly spacious with neutral decor, flat screen TV(good choice of channels), work desk, fridge, microwave and armchair. The soft furnishings were fine although the chair had worn through and ripped on the arms. Housekeeping was spotty, differing amounts of towels each day and sometimes the pillows/bed cushions left on the chair/floor rather than being replaced on the bed. Business centre access was handy as was the fitness room (although v small). The pool area was nice, plenty of loungers and towels and the tiki bar opened at 5 each day so was a good spot for a drink after dinner. We opted for a breakfast package and this was the only real disappointment. The food was absolutely fine, although a little limited in choice however the service was very poor. For the 4 days we stayed there was a tour group of approx 40 people on the hotel. Unfortunately the grill room seemed unable to cope with this. On Friday morning one poor colleague was stressed to the eyeballs trying to handle everyone and was most apologetic. She was however at least pleasant which was a direct contrast to the 2 ladies in attendance over the weekend who completely ignored selected guests (ourselves included) choosing to spend their time openly discussing guests. I've raised the matter of the restaurant staff with the hotel as I think it is imporant they are aware of this. It only takes 2 bad apples to spoil the whole pie and their attitude was not refelective of other staff so I hope it is addressed. I debated on the rating - is it a 3 or a 4 - well had it not been for the restaurant staff I would have been edging towards a 5 so I've gone for a 4. I would (and probably will) happily stay here again however I'm undecided on taking the breakfast package next time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: SectionChief
Reviews.Content: We arrived New Years Eve and had a smooth check in. This was my first time at this location and I picked the HGI because I usually have good stays at this brand without alot of fluff. Breakfast was good for the 2 days we stayed and we made good use of the hot tub, pool, and Tiki bar. Traffic around that area was jammed but we had a good time. Would stay here again when I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisy52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week. The hotel was fantastic. We found all staff to be very friendly and helpful. On arrival the shower in my sons room was faulty - this was fixed almost immediatly. The fridge in our room was also faulty and was also immedialtely replaced with a new one. They sorted any problem and made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: je1026
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Clean Rooms, new carpeting and they were remodeling the halls. Stayed for 10 nights with my wife and son. Sure it's not Disney property, but you'll get a lot more for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn Orlando Needs to Improve”
Reviews.Author: Nana58Florida
Reviews.Content: Our toilet was stopped up the two days we stayed. It was reported and we were given a plunger. I plunged a stopped up toilet every time the bathroom had to be used. When I reported the issue the Reception Clerk questioned the validity of my claim and the General Manager tried to place the blame on me that I should have reported it twice because the first time was never logged. Because I booked through Hotels.com, I was told that I could not be given a refund and I was only offered a one night complimentary stay at another time. When I stated that I had the issue both nights, I was told that I booked through Hotels.com and did not pay full price for my stay. They gave me the impression that since I didn't pay full price my complaint was not taken as serious as someone who had paid full price. The rooms are nice though and the beds are comfortable. This is the first time I have EVER had to make a complaint of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Surftel
Reviews.Content: Had to stay one night on business for a quick meeting nearbye. Front desk crew was very nice and quick. Room was well appointed, spotless, and AC worked great. Fitness center was small but also clean, outdoor pool looked nice but I did not have time to go in. One of the few hotels which act sincere when they ask you if you enjoyed your stay. Although, I doubt I will be travelling back anytime soon, if I do I am definately staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Like This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 3 nights. The two ladies working the front desk during the day were rude and not accomodating at all. We were very dissapointed because the service that we received was not typical for Hilton Hotels. The room was ok, not great. I would not stay there again, nor would I recomend this hotel to anyone. I must add that the lady who was there late at night was great! We arrived late, (after 11 pm.) She was extremely helpful. It's too bad we were not able to deal with her during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Wafflebox
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be fairly cheap and you got good value for your money. The hotel was clean, comfortable and spacious. Within walking distance of some great places to eat and they have a shuttle bus to the big attractions. The tiki bar is excellent for a few chilled out drinks and the pool is nice too, as is the seating around the pool. Wasn't overly busy when we were there so the pool and bar was very relaxing and both were open until 11pm. This is GREAT value for money - don't waste your money on the more expensive hotels nearby. If you're doing the whole theme part thing anyway you spend very little time in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We booked this hotel based on the other reviews on this website and they were all spot on. Hotel room was exactly as the pictures on their website. Clean towels & toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, soap, body lotion) every day. Nice fluffy pillows, comfortable beds, rooms nice & clean. Good size bathroom with marble top & strong shower (over the bath). We ate in the hotel a couple of times and although the food was a bit more expensive than eating out, it was very good. All the receptionists were very friendly & helpful. Jon on the desk that dealt with the Theme Park tickets was also very friendly & helpful & did not try & push you to buy things you didnt need or wasnt necessary. He was also a good point for information. I would ask for a room with a view overlooking the pool as i think the other side of the hotel looks out over the car park. As other people have mentioned the hotel was very quiet, no kids etc running around making alot of noise, and no outside noise to bother you either. It takes about 5 minutes to walk down to International Drive from the hotel. I couldnt fault this hotel at all. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyJimGR
Reviews.Content: The HGI was very clean and comfortable. I enjoyed the pool area, which was nicely landscaped and included a tiki bar. the breakfast buffet was great. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The only drawback in my estimation is it was a long block off I Drive and the trolley stop. It was an especially good deal for Hilton Honors members as they run a point stretcher in early June (15000/ night)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I booked the HGI because I didn't want to stay at the conference hotel at Universal (Royal Pacific). It was much more peaceful at the HGI. I think it helps that the hotel is set back from I-drive somewhat. During my 4 night stay, I was amazed how much I could hear through my walls. I actually heard someone peeing and then flushing the toliet above me. Yikes! The beds are comfortable and on par with other Hilton properties. I really liked the Neutrogena tolietries. I wish they were in all Hiltons instead of Crabtree and Evelyn. The business center was easy to use, and I so glad they didn't charge for internet use and printing. I might try the Homewood Suites across the street next time if the rooms are quiter than HGI. Overall though, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Walls paper thin”
Reviews.Author: jordanboos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. But that is about all it has going for it..We stayed on the 2nd floor. We wanted to get a good nights sleep go to bed early, get up early...Anyway the people next door come in around 10pm yelling and screaming, slamming doors,etc. The walls were so thin we could hear every conversation. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Even Assistant General Manager is rude”
Reviews.Author: JohnBradley
Reviews.Content: The Worse I have ever stayed. Poor Service, front desk clerk, when checked me in was talking on his personal cell phone and said " hey yo hold on a seconf". I got up and my rooms keys did not work and the front desk clerk said " [--] man you were being sent to somebody's else room, MY BAD". The breakfast is tastless, even the Assistant General Manager is so rude that is unbelievable. Rooms were okay besdie the fact that the window treatment were horrible. but because of the service I would never go back, not even for a get way with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTripper
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews for this hotel I decided to stay. Service was excellent, room was very clean. Great view. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights between xmas and new year. When we arrived the room we were given had a stale smell to it. The desk informed us this was because we had been given a smoking room. They said they couldn't move us until 4 nights in. They did however say they would spray the room, which made no difference. However after further complaints, we were finally moved in to a non-smoking room. Not only was the room much better, we also had a duvet, rather than blankets, which I really can not sleep with. On New Years Eve we also had a perfect view of fireworks from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: g230
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Location . Thought it might be a bit noisy from the I4 but it was not. Only took us 15 minutes to get to the Florida Mall and 12 minutes to Mall of Millennia Room was large with 2 double beds , fridge, micro & coffee maker. The window even opened for fresh air The only downside was that it had 3 large horrible pictures of fish- as I have a fish phobia, the staff kindly gave me 3 sheets to cover the pictures up, all the rooms have the same pictures. The pool & spa were clear and very quite , it was so relaxing sitting on the sun lounges, the spa was so warmâ€¦.. The only down side was we arrived on Thanksgiving and there was a special meal in the restaurant which sounded wonderful , however it was the worse meal I have ever had in America. We did give feedback to the Manager who was very apologetic. All in all I would return to this hotel and also recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Clean, Convieniet and Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: slc72
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel for the weekend. I am very happy to say that we had no problems what so ever. Overall the hotel is clean and nicely deocorated. We didnt use any of the ammenities since we just went up to Orlando to go to Disney. But we did see they have a business center and a gym. We know they have a pool and Tiki bar, but again we didnt look into it since we werent going to use it. The hotel is about a mile or two off of I-4 so it is easy to get to and to get to. It is convienient if you have your own car. I dont know what if any shuttle services they have since we did not ask about it. I have to say check in was great the staff was nice and helpful. We asked for driving directions and they gave us a accurtate print out of driving directions to each major theme park and attraction. they had the rolling carts for your luggage and two elevators. Our rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. Fridge and Microwave and two double beds. A/C worked very well. We booked the bed and breakfast package and it was awesome. For breakfast they have bacon, sausage, fruits, bagels, toast, cereal, yogurt, different types of milk, fresh orange juice coffee, teas, they had fresh cooked to order french toast, omlets, waffle maker with fruit toppings, muffins, pastries, oatmeal, grits in all it was a complete breakfast with all you can think of. (I know how important that breakfast is when you are going to the park for the day and you want to eat well before you go) The lobby was decorated really nicely for the holidays. In all we definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the best Hilton I've stayed at in a while”
Reviews.Author: oo63
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of Hilton chain hotels in the past and none of them had really impress me. The Garden Inn, however, is a of a different breed. My 7-night stay in a double standard guest room was strictly for business. The location of this hotel is isolated from the main strip, so it is very quiet at night, allowing for a good night's sleep. Check-in was a breeze. My roommate and I were able to check-in individually without having to wait for the credit card holder of our company to check everybody in as a group. Bethzaida, who assisted us with our check-in is very friendly and helpful. My room was cleaned and fixed up nicely prior to my arrival, giving me a nice warm welcome. The bed is very comfortable, the water turns hot or cold almost instantly. The bathroom is clean and has ample space. The room is also equipped with a TV coupled with 60 different channels for your entertainment. Nintendo 64 entertainment is available for a fee. A nice micro-frige is available to keep beverages and leftover food nice and cold. The included microwave allows you to conveniently warm up said leftover food. And if you have any dry goods, like oatmeal, you can store them in the cupboard right above the microwave to avoid clutter. If you need internet access, this hotel provides complimentary high-speed internet access at your finger tip. The CAT5 ethernet cable is provided, so you do not need to bring your own. Aside from the core amenities mentioned above, the hotel also includes a small fitness center, a pool, a business center, and a Tiki Bar open for business to supply your alcoholic needs after a long day of work or play. Laundry room is available at the end of each floor ($1.00 for cleaning, $1.00 for drying and $1.00 for detergent available at the pantry pavilion). Coffee is served in the morning. Breakfast can be had at the American Grill in the lobby for a small price. They also serve lunch and dinner as well. The overall atmosphere of this hotel is very businessesque. There were no noisy children or horsing around that are prevailent in other hotels nearby. Not even at the pool. I have no complaints other than the pillows. There were only two pillows per bed and they are very, very flat from usage. I had to double stack them to make one barely comfortable pillow and even then wasn't very comforting. I recommend bringing your own pillow for your stay. I give this hotel a five-star because it satisfied all my needs after an 8-hour shift at the Orange County Convention Center from exhibiting at a tradeshow.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best budget hotels on IDrive”
Reviews.Author: Steve_&_Nikki
Reviews.Content: This is the second year running we have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, this stay was as good as the first. We would certainly return on our next trip to Orlando. It seems to cater more for business clientele as opposed to tourists, this seems to make it very quiet. no screaming kids :-) They have added a Tiki bar to the pool area which is open every evening. The rooms are a good size, very very clean. The beds are exceedingly comfortable. The staff are very friendly, checking in and out is a breeze. What more could you want , A great place to stay for the Orlando attractions.
